attributes.action: Change length of time that offences stay on a persons criminal record to 10 yrs
attributes.background: If an offence stays on your record for life you're punished for life. The law should be changed so that if no further crimes are committed after 10 years the offence should be removed from there basic record. Enhanced checks for work places with children/vulnerable adults should stay permanently.
attributes.additional_details: Any offence with a 30 month+ sentence stays on record for life regardless of the type of crime/number of offences committed. Yes people need to be punished for breaking the law but if there sentence is served and they commit no further crimes they should be able to move on and build a life. People cannot get jobs because of their record and end up re-offending, homeless and with mental health issues. Changing the law will reduce crime rates, improve peoples well-being.

attributes.action: take alcohol off display in shops like cigarettes and no advertising
attributes.background:
Alcohol-related crime in the UK is estimated to cost between £8bn and £13bn per year.
A fifth (29%) of all violent incidents in 2013–14 took place in or around a pub or club. ...
attributes.additional_details: There were 8,270 casualties of drink driving accidents in the UK in 2013, including 240 fatalities and 1,100 people who suffered serious injury.

attributes.action: The import and personal use of DMT-containing plant materials should be legal.
attributes.background: While the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016 is right to ban some dangerous legal highs, a blanket ban is ill-considered. Personal use and import of DMT-containing plant materials, in their natural form, should be legal, especially since the possession of said item is NOT a crime under this new act.
attributes.additional_details:
Certain plants and plant materials found in nature have long been used for curing depression, learning about consciousness and developing spirituality for those who find religion ineffective. Plants used for 'Ayahuasca' have powerful healing properties and have been used by many to help overcome depression, anxiety and stress. Personal use can allow people to study spirituality, the nature of our existence and consciousness as a right of their freedom.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayahuasca

attributes.action: To ban electronic cigarettes in all public places in England.
attributes.background: They have not been around long enough for scientist to say whether electronic cigarettes cause harm to individuals. Young people are using them as a fashion accessory, not to give up smoking.
attributes.additional_details:
There are a couple of young people in my office at work, who compares the different flavors they have tried and how much they like them.  This is not encouraging them to give up.

There is nothing worse than seeing someone smoking them in a public place, the substance coming out of them is absolutely disgusting.

attributes.action: Change The General Election Voting System From FPTP To Instant-Runoff Voting
attributes.background: Hello, I am Emmanuel and I am 13 years old and came across a video on YouTube that displayed how bad the first past the post voting system is. In its simplest form FPTP is basically winner takes all. In the general election the Conservatives won 36.9% of the votes but they have 100% of the power.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to change the the the general election voting system from FPTP to IRV because in IRV there is definitely a majority winner so most people who vote will at least be moderately happy.

This YouTube video explains how bad FPTP is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s7tWHJfhiyo

This YouTube video explains how much better IRV is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Y3jE3B8HsE

attributes.action: Suspend wage reviews for senior civil servants until after brexit negotiations
attributes.background: Civil servants shouldn't need motivating to do their job of backing British interests but unfortunately they have been so intermingled with the EU for so long. They could be inclined to drag thing's out hoping for a new Pro EU government or a second referendum.
attributes.additional_details: So I suggest halting all senior service pay a promotion reviews until after the brexit process has been completed with a cut off date of 2019 a full year before the next generation election. Then the retrospective senior service reviews will be based on past brexit performance not a half hearted effort of the reluctant

attributes.action: Anti Flash Hoods to be Mandatory Under SOLAS Regs
attributes.background: Ammend SOLAS Regulations to make the issue of Anti Flash Hoods a mandatory requirement as part of ships fire fighting equipment

attributes.action: help with more funding for veterans with PTSD and family's
attributes.background: Currently change step have been denied extra funding to carry on providing a mentoring service for veterans suffering PTSD and families, by losing this much needed service, this could have a negative impact on the mental health issues of veterans,
attributes.additional_details:
Change Step, based in Colwyn Bay, Conwy county, said 29 workers would lose their jobs following an unsuccessful bid for further funding.
The charity said it was still "determined to carry on".
The Ministry of Defence, which awarded the charity £995,918 in 2013, said it could apply for further funding "in the coming months and years".

attributes.action: An annual National Sports Day to grow participation in sport & physical activity
attributes.background: One day a year should be designated a National Sports Day (#sportsday). Saturday 27th August 2016 saw the #IAmTeamGB campaign hold free events around the country to encourage people to participate in sport and physical activity. This should become a government supported annual national event.
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2015 Tracey Crouch MP Minister for Sport, Tourism and Heritage launched 'Sporting Future: A New Strategy for an Active Nation', encouraging sport and physical activity as a national priority. Shortly after, Jennie Price Chief Executive, Sport England launched the new 2016-2021 strategy 'Sport England: Towards An Active Nation'.

We need an annual National Sports Day to bring these strategies to life and to capitalise on Team GB & Paralympics GB's potential to inspire the nation.

attributes.action: Ban all HGVs from the third lane of all motorways
attributes.background: Motorway expansion was meant to increase traffic flow but, with lorries using lanes 1 2 and 3, traffic bunches up causing congestion

attributes.action: Consolidate mobile telephone infrastructure networks under one umbrella company
attributes.background: Many of us consumers choose a mobile provider based on coverage in the areas where we live and work. But when we travel we often find connectivity is poor (or non-existent) in certain areas if we are customers of the wrong provider.
attributes.additional_details: If the network infrastructure were to become owned by one umbrella company, then we could have excellent coverage no matter with which provider we were customers. The providers would then have a similar business relationship with the umbrella company as train operators have with Network Rail, or broadband providers have with BT Openreach. In attracting customers, providers could no longer rely on coverage, but would need to find innovative ways to be competitive.

attributes.action: An NHS research investment donation app for mobile phones and computers.
attributes.background: Well I have ulcerative colitis and every time I go to hospital I notice there are a lot of people who would like to be able to do more and feel as if they can do nothing at least with a app people can send money to invest in research in areas where they would like to see improvements in research.
attributes.additional_details: I don't feel evidence is something needed in this case. Good people invest in good things and this is one of them.

attributes.action: Address the rise in incidences of dangerous driving on UK roads.
attributes.background: There is a lack of deterrent for dangerous drivers on UK roads. Speeding, illegal manoeuvring and blatant disregard for the Highway Code seem to have become common-place. The UK needs to rethink it's reliance on speed cameras, speed humps, etc. and begin enforcing speed and dangerous driving laws.

attributes.action: Make all drivers carrying passengers for reward take the DVSA Practical & CPC
attributes.background: At present it is optional if licensing authorities make new hackney/ph drivers take a dvsa test. I call for all drivers present and new of any licensing borough to ensure all drivers complete a dvsa practical, hazard perception & cpc. All other professional drivers have to and only equal they do to.
attributes.additional_details: Road safety is becoming harder to tackle across the UK, if we lead the way in Europe on how to maintain road safety by ensuring all drivers who drive for hire & reward take the steps as bus & lorry drivers have then we are one step closer to ensuring safety of passengers in any Taxi/PH vehicle & other road users for social, domestic, pleasure, commercial & business use too. Where the public are concerned this is vital for road safety and passenger reassurance that drivers are trained correctly.

attributes.action: Represent Wales in the Union Jack incorporating Y Ddraig Goch (The Welsh Dragon)
attributes.background:
When the Union Jack was introduced in 1606 its design did and still does today represent the four nations which make up the United Kingdom. 

However, it is only made up of three of the constituent countries' flags and we believe, in the spirit of the unity it represents - that should change.
attributes.additional_details:
Agnieszka, S. (2013) The Union Flag and Flags of the United Kingdom. Section Parliament and Constitution Centre, UK.

Cleans, G. (2007) Union Jack should include Welsh Flag, says MP. The Daily Telegraph, UK. 
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/1570613/Union-Jack-should-include-Welsh-flag-says-MP.html

Contributors: Jacob William Billingsley, James Stacey Mayes, Patrick John Alderson, Ruari Iain Macneil

attributes.action: Implement driving evaluations to make UK roads safer
attributes.background: Driving evaluations should become a regular requirement in the UK. By introducing a standard driving evaluation every 5 years (approx.) to deem drivers 'safe to drive', road fatalities and casualties should decrease, and the overall safety level of the roads should improve.
attributes.additional_details:
There was a recorded 24,610 people killed or seriously injured in car accidents between 1st April 2015 - 31st March 2016.

Motor traffic levels have increased 1.8% in the rolling year. It is important to ensure road safety is at the highest levels.

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/543662/quarterly-estimates-january-to-march-2016.pdf

attributes.action: Allow fathers to stay with poorly babies in hospitals
attributes.background: on 3rd August 2016 my 4 day old daughter was rushed to hospital because she wasn't breathing properly, once we were seen we were sent to a ward, where I (Father) was told I had to leave her and go home because the ward was for women.
attributes.additional_details: I was forced to leave my baby in the hospital because they ward staff would not allow me to stay with her. I believe men should be allowed to stay with their children regardless!

attributes.action: Ensure restaurant/food seller menus list any present allergens in their food
attributes.background: In many restaurants it is difficult to know if an allergen is present in the food being served. Allergy sufferers should be able to see what is going into their food, as they can on supermarket packaging. A menu with a full list of ingredients should therefore be available if required.

attributes.action: All petrol/diesel pumps must display taxes taken per litre and per gallon.
attributes.background: Most people aren't aware that the vast majority of the cost of fuel doesn't go to the oil companies who have to drill to find the stuff, transport it around the world, refine it, and deliver it to your local garage, but to the state that has done none of this.
attributes.additional_details: The sum of taxes should include VAT and the taxation of the oil companies and the garages or stores who provide the pumps.

attributes.action: Prevent motorway central reservation grass cutting
attributes.background: The cost in time and lost commerce is immense and so un-necessary, it's naturally sown wild grasses and flowers (and helps prevent glare at night from headlamps on the opposite carriageway). Three times this week I have been delayed by these works totalling 3 hours in delays.

attributes.action: Ban political nominations for the Queens honours list
attributes.background: The curry system has been brought into disrepute by David Cameron.

attributes.action: Stop the creation of retirement honours and dissolution honours.
attributes.background: Using these honours to reward friends and party backers brings the whole honours system into disrepute.

attributes.action: Stronger convictions on burglaries
attributes.background: Too many criminals get away with burglary and many continue to reoffend. Preventing burglary is not enough, we need tougher sentences to reduce the amount of offences.
attributes.additional_details: The worst crime against working people is what we have earned and worked hard for is taken away from us.

attributes.action: Make changes to the Dartford crossing procedure.
attributes.background: When using the Dartford river crossing there are signs telling drivers when and how to pay but these are easily missed. I propose that they either bring back the tolls or send a letter to drivers telling them when and how to pay.

attributes.action: Force bars, restaurants and nightclubs to sell more varieties of diet drinks
attributes.background: Despite an apparent obesity crisis in the UK and more people being diagnosed with diabetes, drinking establishments don't sell enough diet drinks. These venues should be forced to sell the diet variety of any soft drink they sell, to improve peoples health and wellbeing.

attributes.action: The UK to leave the EU Single Market by the end of 2016
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM government to respect the democratic will of the people and as such, make immediate arrangements for the UK to completely withdraw from the EU Single Market by no later than the end of 2016.

attributes.action: send an allied task force to eliminate ISIS
attributes.background: ISIS must be destroyed before they can kill more innocent civilians.

attributes.action: Stop banks charging,for IN THE RED on pensioners & those on low incomes,
attributes.background: Fed up on this action, continually in the red simply because of these £32 deductions!
attributes.additional_details: Now we are enforced to get paid by the Banks, this did not happen when we were paid by the Post Office, with our Pension Books

attributes.action: Stop media from publicising the nationality of criminals to prevent prejudice
attributes.background: If a nationality is associated with a horrible act of violence in the media, it is easy for readers to then associate people of that nationality with acts of terror and violence. This can make innocent people of that nationality very prone to racism and prejudice.

attributes.action: Invest more in our National Security to avoid an attack in the UK
attributes.background: Europe is getting unsecured. There has been terror attacks in the most important countries like France, Belgium and Germany. The United Kingdom may be affected in the future as well. We more security, especially on train staions, crowded places, Tourist attractions and big cities.

attributes.action: Switch the UK timezone to match the rest of Europe
attributes.background: The rest of western Europe has changed their timezone to UTC + 1 and since these countries are extremely close, it would be sense from a trade, enterprise and consumer point of view that this should be changed for the better.

attributes.action: Let motorcycle riders over 25, drive cars up to 1.0 without L plates and test
attributes.background: I can drive safely and confidently, and so can all other motorcyclists that are old enough to do this maturely. Ie over 25 year olds. In a low powered car it is going to be far safer in poor weather, rain. Wind,  winter conditions etc than on a motorcycle without the hassle and cost of another test

attributes.action: Amend the planning rules away from favouring development
attributes.background: Developers seemingly put forward a massive plan for development and consult only a few neighbouring roads, plus put up a couple of laminated notices. Local councils can put out local plan consultations with no publicity. They should both be required to inform a far larger section of local population
attributes.additional_details: Planning rules seem to favour rich developers against local objections. This should be sorted so that development plans can no longer be released with minimal publicity and fanfare, and then developers or Local councils who want massive development to occur claim that minimal protest counts as approval for their plans

attributes.action: Change School Holiday Rules
attributes.background:
I have 2 children and have worked in a school for 6 years.
Booking a holiday in the school break can be double the amount than in term time,as the travel firms give school holiday weeks high season rates, making it impossible for lots of families to go away on holiday.
Lets change this.
attributes.additional_details:
The 6 week holiday is to long for many reasons.
I suggest taking 2 weeks off the 6 week break.Let children have these 2 weeks a year in term time,this way there will be no set period each year for holiday companies to include them in high season rates, as there would be if added to half term breaks.The teachers could take their 2 weeks the last week of the Summer and Autumn terms, as these are wind down weeks and not much work takes place,it could easily be covered by TA's or relief teachers.

attributes.action: Change the law, to give people in rural village communities the right to buy.
attributes.background: I’m living in a housing association home in a village I grew up in.The Housing (Right to Acquire or Enfranchise)(Designated Rural Areas in the Southwest) Order 1997  stops selling of right to buy properties in villages/towns with populations of less than 3000 residents it is unfair  on rural tenants
attributes.additional_details: My application to have the right to aquire/buy in January 2016 was rejected. I’ve written to and been ignored by my local MP for support and received an unsatisfactory reply from Brandon Lewis, Housing Minister at the time (Even though he agrees to the sale of housing association homes). My only recourse is this petition to get the issue raised in parliament and hopefully remove the 3000 resident  stipulation as the housing and planning bill including, right to buy is currently being considered

attributes.action: Theresa May; Appoint a Minister of State for Climate Change
attributes.background: In Theresa May's first Cabinet appointments she abolished the Secretary of State for Energy and Climate Change moving the brief with Business. To ensure that Climate Change is at the heart of British politics we want a Climate Change Minister to work with all departments.
attributes.additional_details: Since the creation of the Energy and Climate Change department, climate change policy has largely been driven by using more sustainable energy sources. A new Climate Change Minister working in the Business department  could design new climate change policies that are not only just focused on sustainable energy sources. A new Climate Change Minister could be responsible for growing the green economy and encouraging corporate social responsibility.

attributes.action: Ban public transport peak fares, especially on suburban commuter routes.
attributes.background: The UK is one of the few countries in the world where commuter public transport users suffer a peak fare system, with transport often owned by foreign interests. Commuters are essentially being penalised and profited from unnecessarily as they go to work, often making car usage more attractive.
attributes.additional_details:
Budapest - 80p per individual suburban bus or underground journey any time of day 
Kuala Lumpar -  23p per stop on underground Metro (modern air-conditioned Siemens trains) any time of day
Barcelona - £1.80 individual bus or underground journey any time of day
Lisbon - individual journey bus on-board fare - £1.50 any time of day
Melbourne - all-zone 2-hour tram or bus ticket, £2 any time of day
Bangkok - daily any time Skytrain pass £2.60 (Bangkok is a very big city of 12 million people!)

attributes.action: We demand Art. 50 of the Lisbon Treaty be invoked within three months hereof.
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016, we, the people of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland delivered a mandate, pursuant to the EU Referendum Act 2015, that we exit the EU. We hereby demand that effect be given to said mandate by way of invoking Art. 50 of the Lisbon Treaty within 3 months.
attributes.additional_details:
"I do declare that no foreign prince, person, prelate, state or potentate hath or ought to have jurisdiction, power, superiority, pre-eminence or authority within this Realm." - Bill of Rights, 1689

These words serve to enshrine British sovereignty in its Constitution which remains violated for as long as the UK is a member of the EU. Notwithstanding a mandate to remedy the position by exiting the EU,  PM Ms. May suggests exit will be delayed or worse, not happen at all. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Allow encrypted information to be accessed by security services and government
attributes.background: Terrorists and criminals frequently use the Internet and social media to encourage acts of terrorism and criminal activity. If there is a cause for concern, the government and security services should be allowed access to prevent attacks and protect citizens.

attributes.action: Use £23.4 billion  Trident costs to feed, protect and educate our children.
attributes.background: Every year the poorest people in Britain are asked to support other poor people by donating to children in need etc.  We ask that the money for Trident be spent to protect vulnerable children and that those who want Trident hold a telethon to raise money for it.
attributes.additional_details: People of all ages, but especially children are suffering and living in unacceptable poverty whilst hard working tax payers watch their money being spent on weapons of mass destruction that aren't wanted and will never be used.  This must change.

attributes.action: Make relevant work experience mandatory for students doing University courses.
attributes.background: I have found many Graduates I know who are unable to secure themselves job roles due to lack of experience. Also according to The Guardian in 2013, almost half of the Graduates are jobless. They are rejected due to the fact that they do not have 1 year experience. Exception is for those who have it.
attributes.additional_details:
A source for my claim is shown below: https://www.theguardian.com/business/2013/nov/19/half-recent-uk-graduates-stuck-jobs-ons

By making gaining work experience proposal mandatory, economy may boost. Less JSA claimants. Less students debts. The list goes on. It usually takes years and I mean years for Graduates to secure their relevant job roles due to lack of experience. Yes, you may say that they can do work experience while searching but that's not always the case due to lack of finance.

attributes.action: Final Leader elections in Government or Opposition should be by national vote.
attributes.background: Parlimentary leadership elections are decided by a small fraction of the electorate. This could see a vastly different Prime Minister or leader of the Opposition than the electorate intended to put in power and could in instances give rise to instability at a time when greater stability is required.

attributes.action: Procure the Government to adopt Geraint Davies's private member's Bill.
attributes.background:
Many false and misleading claims were made during the campaign which deceived people who were not able to judge the issues dispassionately. 
These gross misrepresentations at the very least justify a second referendum to determine whether the result is truly the settled will of the people.
attributes.additional_details:
37% of the eligible electorate voted to leave, which means that 63% did not.
Many quite simply were duped into believing extravagant promises which were unachievable, and on which the polititians concerned backtracked afterwards.
Referenda are not binding. 
The sheer magnitude of the consequences already being felt is too great to allow the fundamentally flawed result to be implemented without at the very least clarification of the settled will of the people, or a free vote in both Houses.

attributes.action: Giving food brought to concerts to homeless so that none goes to waste.
attributes.background: Having recently changed my eating habits and diet that I was going to take some oats and dried fruit at a concert to enjoy as I hoped to sneak them through, in retrospect this was silly but I was still appalled that they simply threw it away despite everything I had being perfectly edible!

attributes.action: Make it so you do not have to declare none fault accidents on motor insurance
attributes.background: Why are people been penalised for something they didn't cause or do motor insurance goes up for thous who had a accident that wasn't their fault and it shouldn't no longer be aloud to happen we should have to tell the insurance company for accident that are none fault

attributes.action: We should have a cross party coalition to negotiate our exit from the EU.
attributes.background:
Our exit from the EU should be negotiated with at least two members from the Brexit camp.
This isn't just a petition aimed at people who voted Leave, these negotiations affect all of us, so please sign this petition and let's get the right people in the negotiations to get the right deal for us!

attributes.action: Lower the age of sexual consent to 14 if both parties are under 16
attributes.background: I would like action on this petition because I feel that sexual consent laws are outdated. I feel as if sexual consent should be legal (if both under 16 and over 14)  like a "Romeo and Juliet" Law like they have in other countries. I think this would help teenagers feel better about sexual consent.

attributes.action: Conduct an Independence referendum for Scotland,Wales and Northern Ireland
attributes.background: We the people living in the UK under HM's government rule after voting on EU regarding referendum demand an Independence referendum for the states of Wales,Scotland and Northern Ireland.People should have the right of such a referendum because after Brexit vote opinions of people are changed.

attributes.action: A General election before October and summer recess in parliament cancelled?
attributes.background:
1. For there to be a change in the law with immediate effect to enable a general election.
2. For parliamentary summer recess to be cancelled to enable resolution of Brexit.
3. A change in the law to separate financial services from electoral register to enable all and the young to vote.
attributes.additional_details: The 1st two articles in this are very much self explanatory, however article 3' is specifically designed to ensure those who due to debt collectors having access to the electoral registration system, so can track those poor people down who were victims of the GEC, can finally clear house in parliament and punish those responsible and not the immigrants blamed for the countries mess.  Also article 3' will see the law change to make it easy for the UK's young to vote by allowing temp registration.

attributes.action: Ensure the Health Secretary is a qualified doctor of medicine.
attributes.background: The current health secretary has no medical experience, which is illogical with regards to the responsibility involved in such a job. He is also known to have supported medical practices with no scientific basis. This highlights clear problems with the way in which the health secretary is appointed.
